trans-unit.source: Creating a database from a backup copy

seg-source.mrk: Creating a database from a backup copy

target.mrk: Creating a database from a backup copy

trans-unit.source: To create a database from a full backup copy at a specified location, specify the createFrom=path attribute in the boot-time connection URL.

seg-source.mrk: To create a database from a full backup copy at a specified location, specify the createFrom=path attribute in the boot-time connection URL.

target.mrk: To create a database from a full backup copy at a specified location, specify the createFrom=path attribute in the boot-time connection URL.

trans-unit.source: Creating a database from a backup copy

seg-source.mrk: Creating a database from a backup copy

target.mrk: Creating a database from a backup copy

trans-unit.source: If there is already a database with the same name in <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph>, an error will occur and the existing database will be left intact. If there is not an existing database with the same name in the current <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> location, the system will copy the whole database from the backup location to <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> and start it.

seg-source.mrk: If there is already a database with the same name in <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph>, an error will occur and the existing database will be left intact.

If there is not an existing database with the same name in the current <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> location, the system will copy the whole database from the backup location to <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> and start it.

target.mrk: If there is already a database with the same name in <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph>, an error will occur and the existing database will be left intact.

If there is not an existing database with the same name in the current <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> location, the system will copy the whole database from the backup location to <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> and start it.

trans-unit.source: The log files are also copied to the default location. You can use the logDevice attribute in conjunction with the createFrom=path attribute to store logs in a different location. With the createFrom=path attribute, you do not need to copy the individual log files to the log directory.

seg-source.mrk: The log files are also copied to the default location.
You can use the logDevice attribute in conjunction with the createFrom=path attribute to store logs in a different location.
With the createFrom=path attribute, you do not need to copy the individual log files to the log directory.

target.mrk: The log files are also copied to the default location.
You can use the logDevice attribute in conjunction with the createFrom=path attribute to store logs in a different location.
With the createFrom=path attribute, you do not need to copy the individual log files to the log directory.

trans-unit.source: For example, to create the sample database from a backup copy in <codeph>c:\mybackups\sample</codeph>, the connection URL should be:

seg-source.mrk: For example, to create the sample database from a backup copy in <codeph>c:\mybackups\sample</codeph>, the connection URL should be:

target.mrk: For example, to create the sample database from a backup copy in <codeph>c:\mybackups\sample</codeph>, the connection URL should be:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see "createFrom=path attribute" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information, see "createFrom=path attribute" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information, see "createFrom=path attribute" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.
